extractions.description: This paper investigates the generalization properties and limitations of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in learning identity effects, with applications in computational linguistics and chemistry. It analyzes GNN performance under different conditions and highlights the importance of model architecture and data encoding.

title.value: Generalization Limits of Graph Neural Networks in Identity Effects Learning
title.justification: The title is directly copied from the provided text, ensuring accuracy.
title.quote: Generalization Limits of Graph Neural Networks in Identity Effects Learning

type.justification: The paper contains theoretical analysis supported by extensive numerical experiments.
type.quote: Our theoretical analysis is supported by an extensive numerical study.

research_field.justification: The paper focuses on analyzing the generalization properties and limitations of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs), which is evident from the title and content.
research_field.quote: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have emerged as a powerful tool for data-driven learning on various graph domains.

sub_research_field.justification: The paper investigates how GNNs learn and generalize identity effects, which fits within the sub-research field of learning and generalization within deep learning.
sub_research_field.quote: This work investigates the generalization limits and capabilities of GNNs when learning identity effects.

name.justification: The dataset is introduced to analyze GNNs performance in classifying two-letter words and to validate theoretical findings.
name.quote: As a practical application of Theorem 3.1 to identity effects, we consider the problem of classifying identical two-letter words of the English alphabet.

name.justification: The dataset is introduced to analyze GNNs' ability to classify symmetric and asymmetric dicyclic graphs.
name.quote: We now analyze the expressivity of GNNs to learn identity effects related to the topology of the graphs in the dataset.
